title: IHC launches AI-driven global reinsurance platform
description: IHC has established a new AI-driven global reinsurance platform headquartered in Abu Dhabi Global Market (ADGM), focusing on accelerating the growth of insurance and capital markets in the Middle East and Asia. The platform is backed by over $1 billion in initial equity commitments, targeting $10 billion in liabilities. It leverages an AI-native approach for enhanced data analytics and capital efficiency. The initiative is in strategic partnership with BlackRock, providing asset management, advisory, and technology capabilities, and Lunate as a partner entering the reinsurance space. The platform offers tailored insurance solutions including Property and Casualty, Life, and specialized products. The company will be chaired by Dr. Sultan Ahmed Al Jaber and led by Mark Wilson, former CEO of Aviva Plc and AIA Group Limited.
source_name: IHC launches global reinsurance platform based in ADGM with strategic partner BlackRock

opportunities.title: AI/ML Technology Integration for Reinsurance Analytics
opportunities.description: AI technology companies specializing in machine learning, data analytics, or natural language processing can collaborate with the new platform to further enhance predictive risk modeling, fraud detection, and claims automation. Such companies can provide plug-in AI models, API services, or bespoke analytics software that integrates seamlessly with the platform’s existing AI-native infrastructure, delivering tangible improvements in underwriting accuracy and operational efficiency.
roadmap_steps: Conduct a market and technical analysis to align offerings with platform needs.
Develop proof-of-concept AI/ML models or analytics tools tailored for insurance and reinsurance data.
Establish contact with IHC’s reinsurance platform strategic partnerships team.
Demonstrate integration capabilities and value with a pilot or case study.
Negotiate pilot or licensing agreements.

opportunities.title: Regional Risk Data Providers for Enhanced Underwriting
opportunities.description: Companies that specialize in geospatial, climate, or socio-economic data collection focused on Middle East and Asian markets can offer granular datasets to improve IHC’s underwriting and risk assessment for property and casualty products. Such collaboration helps the platform provide more tailored insurance solutions, considering region-specific risk profiles and reducing coverage blind spots.
roadmap_steps: Curate and refine relevant regional data assets (climate, catastrophe, economic trends, etc.).
Prepare use cases showcasing improved risk selection or pricing.
Reach out to the platform’s analytics or product development teams.
Discuss pilot data integration or analytics trials.
Align data delivery methods with existing platform interfaces.

opportunities.title: Insurtech SaaS for Digital Distribution Partnerships
opportunities.description: Insurtech firms offering white-label SaaS solutions for digital insurance distribution (such as onboarding portals, embedded insurance, or broker networks) can partner with IHC’s reinsurance platform to expand access to tailored insurance products in the Middle East and Asia. This supports the mutual goal of increasing insurance penetration and operational scalability in emerging markets.
roadmap_steps: Assess the regional regulatory and product fit for digital distribution tools.
Develop co-branded or white-label digital distribution concepts.
Identify key platform decision-makers in channel development.
Demonstrate value via demo or sandbox implementation.
Formalize partnership terms for client onboarding and service delivery.

opportunities.title: Life Sciences and Healthcare Data Partnerships for Life Reinsurance
opportunities.description: Healthcare analytics firms or digital health platforms with large anonymized datasets (wearables, EHR, lifestyle data) can offer data-driven insights to improve underwriting and portfolio management for the platform's life reinsurance products. Enhanced mortality/morbidity analysis based on real-world health data enables more competitive pricing and innovative product design.
roadmap_steps: Structure compliant, anonymized data sets relevant for mortality and morbidity risk.
Map healthcare data fields to insurance metrics and models.
Contact the life insurance solutions or data science team at IHC.
Run joint studies or pilots on underwriting improvements.
Negotiate ongoing data supply or analytics service contracts.
